data.title: Good food, popular spot
data.text: Tried to get in on Saturday am at 11:00 but the place was hopelessly crowded.  Looks to be popular with the locals. You stand in line to order and they bring the food out. We bagged it and came back early on Sunday. Good call that. Got the tamale breakfast which was pretty good, my wife got the half order of biscuits and gravy which was good EXCEPT the portion was still ridiculously huge. Their only egg offering is steamed (like scrambled). Pretty good, but would prefer a choice. Specialty coffee drink as good as they get. The pastry selection looked awesome. Would definitely go back to try other offerings.

data.title: Bring your appetite to this espresso shop!
data.text: I'm not sure which I look forward to more, the coffee, the huge breakfasts, or the king sized pastries and desserts.  This place has a great coffee house vibe, as proven by the always busy dining area on weekend mornings.  The servers are energetic and outgoing, keeping up with the orders no matter how busy.  The food is great, the only 'complaint' is there is so much I can never finish!

data.title: Last minute trip to Boise
data.text:
I heard I had to go here and from the outside I had no idea what I would find on the inside!
Cozy and amazing environment with a friendly energy that helps you "belong".
Moon sized homemade cookies, cinnamon rolls and a breakfast menu to beat the band. Excellent coffee! I couldn't stop telling my husband about this place.

data.title: Best cinnamon rolls
data.text: Not a fan of steamed eggs so we typically come here specifically for our cinnamon roll fix. They are huge, fresh and tasty!

data.title: Good coffee and great pastries
data.text: This was our second visit and it was just as good so I figured I'd better leave a review. They have unique coffee selections ( I've have the Mexican Mocha and The Bit O' Honey) and if pastries are wha you seek they have ginormous scones, muffins, cookies ect. We've had cookies and the scones! Very tasty!

data.title: Big City Best of Boise
data.text: Located near the Modern Hotel, Big City Coffee is way more than just another coffee shop with free wifi. Excellent lunch menu! Fresh ingredients and and healthy (large) portions. I'll definitely be back for more than coffee.

data.title: Delicious Generous Proportions
data.text: Hungry? Look no further. Head over to the Big City Coffee in Boise. Many great choices from finger licking pastry to breakfast/brunch meals for royalty like yourself. Reasonable prices, healthy choices, and enough for 1-2 people, if you are willing to share the delicious food.

data.title: Rainy day coffee
data.text: Excellent and friendly staff. Even better food and drink! Try the monkey tail and some quiche. Can't go wrong with the menu except ordering too much cause portions are BIG!

data.title: A GREAT breakfast place!!
data.text: Love going to this restaurant for breakfast. Whenever I have guests, this is my number one place to take them! Go hungry!!!! The portions are big...the prices are reasonable! There seems to always be a crowd, but don't feel intimidated by that as there are long tables to be shared. Besides breakfasts, there are "goodies" available to for purchase to take with you! Scones, cookies, and lots more.... all freshly baked! A great venue!!!

data.title: Huge portion, great taste, good value
data.text:
Finding big city was easy, it has a good location, nice street, and in a part of downtown with better traffic in and out. 5*

Honestly I wasn't impressed with this coffee when I first stepped in. The space, even though had a comfy feeling, was  quite small and crowded. Crowded in a bad way, the choice of furniture and arrangements could have been much better to accommodate the same amount of guesses with the same space.. 4*

Also because of the crowd, no one seemed to notice us coming in, I had to grab someone to help me clean a dirty table that previous guesses left. They might be busy but leaving a table dirty while having so many guesses was not smart at all. Otherwise, service was good, very friendly servers and cashier! 4.5*

Food was great. It must be noted that the portion is huge and you should be full by spending around 15$ here on food. Again, the taste was quite good, ingredient was fresh and I didn't have much to complain. 4.5*

Overall, great value, best if you go by yourself or with a group of friends.

data.title: Always top notch!
data.text:
I have never had a bad experience at Big City.
Generous portions and excellent coffee.
I love that they will cool down my grandsons hot choc for us so he doesn't have to wait for it to cool.

data.title: long time icon
data.text:
Great food that is well worth the wait.  The coffee drinks are made just right.  You wont find better baked good anywhere.  Maybe someday they hire someone without a tat, lol.
Enjoy!

data.title: Unique
data.text: Great food; great portions; fun, funky atmosphere; unique to Boise;  fabulous bakery items but you have to take them to go, because the portions are so generous!

data.title: Best breakfast and coffee I've ever had at 1 p.m.
data.text: I went here and did not know what to expect.  It wasn't crowded at 1 p.m, but I hear it's crazy crowded in the morning.  I ordered the Milky Way and a breakfast bagel sandwich (egg, cheese and bacon on a bagel).  The staff was so friendly, the food delicious, the service was great and the coffee was fantastic.  This will be my new breakfast spot.

data.title: Amazing food and service!
data.text: This place is a prized gem. The food is always tasty and the pastries are huge and delicious. Coffee is great. The service of all the staff is amazing, especially how crowded this small place gets. They are very efficient and seem to move people through effortlessly while staying upbeat and patient.

data.title: Excellent breakfast
data.text: I had oatmeal and fruit here about 10 mornings ago.  The bowl was enormous and there were more berries than I could eat.  I think I consumed only about half what I was served and it was not because of the quality, only the quantity. It was delicious.  This is truly a place where sharing a meal should be strongly considered.  The restaurant, which is fairly small, had a line the entire time I was there but it moved quickly.

data.title: Bigger is better
data.text: I love taking people new to Boise to big city coffee. The size of the pastries (cinnamon rolls, scones) is huge. A scone and cup of coffee is a meal and a half. The yogurt granola with fruit is another impressive meal. but my favorite is the oven roasted potatoes. I always hold the bacon and add avocado, with Salsa this is a great savory breakfast. I wish they had more egg options. Currently they only serve steamed eggs which seems a little institutionalized compared to the rest of their home made good cooking. And of course the coffee. Wrap your hands around a warm Double D decaf...

data.title: Amazing breakfast and lunch, both served all day! Huge portions and amazing coffee!!
data.text: Boise city coffee is one of my favorite breakfast joints! They are super vegetarian friendly with also having great carnivore options! Everything is served in a huge portion and is so good! Their coffee is amazing and they do espresso drinks! They have a diverse menu and something for everyone! You order your food up front and then take a number back to a table of your choice, they will then bring your food to you. Great service and pastries too! You gotta check out this local secret :)

data.title: I hope you are hungry and able to eat big meals!
data.text:
I love coming to this place when I am in Boise.  I end up ordering two plates:  Rosie's biscuits and gravy and the Otis waffels!  So much food!  I loved both of them even thought most was taken home. Their coffee is outstanding!  I would recommend coming and trying it out.  

They possess a friendly staff, great service and great food!  

I would recommend this place to a friend.

data.title: Great coffee!
data.text: We had breakfast there.  The servings were huge.  Love the decor and he fact that they play old country music soft enough to actually converse during breakfast....what a concept!
